byline.contributor: Eric Lichtblau reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York. Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: American Crossroads, super PAC founded by Karl Rove and other leading Republican strategists, has been tossed turbulently by fluid political landscape that is challenging its pre-eminence and possibly its survival; group faces IRS review and strong competition for donors from new generation of PACs by supporters of leading GOP candidates in 2016 presidential campaign.
lead_paragraph: The “super PAC,” a brainchild of Karl Rove and other leading Republican strategists, has been buffeted by a rapidly changing political landscape.

headline.main: Rove’s Crossroads PAC Is No Longer G.O.P.’s ‘Big Dog’
headline.print_headline: Rove’s Group Is No Longer ‘The Big Dog’

snippet: The “super PAC,” a brainchild of Karl Rove and other leading Republican strategists, has been buffeted by a rapidly changing political landscape.
